title: if you think pool party zoe is sexualizing children, i hope you don't go near any public pools
body: literally a child in a typical child's swimsuit. you puritans would be shocked to learn that kids who look exactly like zoe tend to wear bikinis nowadays. if you have a problem with it, it probably says more about you than it does about the skin design team or riot

replies.body: W....were there people making these comments?

> W....were there people making these comments?

oh yes they were, endlessly especially in the comment section for the trailer for the pool party skins.

hashinshin recently made a video on "sexualization" in LoL. He's always seemed weird but that video is what made me realize there's something mentally off about him. He was disturbed by Zoe's pool outfit and classified it as a kind of "sexualization." Not to mention the whole video was scattered, pointless, only mentioned women, and was totally uncompelling.

Women today show too much ankle!
Yes, yes we have.

> hashinshin recently made a video on "sexualization" in LoL. He's always seemed weird but that video is what made me realize there's something mentally off about him. He was disturbed by Zoe's pool outfit and classified it as a kind of "sexualization." Not to mention the video was scattered, pointless, only mentioned women, and totally uncompelling.

But then again, it's Hashinshin
Or maybe hes just playing it for views  like most of youtubers who gets views for making fuking drama out of everything...

It wasn't entertaining enough for that. He was dead serious and watching it felt creepy and uncomfortable, many people couldn't get through all of it. He was asserting harmless quotes with mild innuendo that have been in the game for years are evil and shit, saying every single one of Vayne's  skins are highly oversexualized, like it's an actual insight into how he looks at women and it's disturbing. I'm not surprised he ended up like this though given his lifestyle

Does he look or act like someone who has any healthy relationships with women aside from his mom? It was discomforting how he was talking about sexualization in media, like it was a completely foreign concept to him.
I saw that video and a lot of his points were absolutely ridiculous, ESPECIALLY about the Pool Party skins and the boob plate.

> [{quoted}](name=Legend of Rammus,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=lT4OE4LF,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-08-14T12:47:20.688+0000)

Didn't he mention double standards? How almost all the men have abs/fit body but anytime a woman champion comes out with a good body its 'sexualization'? I don't remember him mentioning Zoe. Which video is it?

https://youtu.be/BXjJgu0FMNs?t=253

In his list titled "champions with fetish or sexualized skins"

> [{quoted}](name=Jamaree,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=lT4OE4LF,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-08-14T07:42:20.712+0000)
>
> W....were there people making these comments?

So many that I'm legitimately concerned.

Also, if someone really thinks that PP Zoe sexualizes her... I'm pretty sure they're the one with the sexual thoughts they are apparently condemning.

> [{quoted}](name=DearPear,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=lT4OE4LF,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2018-08-14T14:04:55.642+0000)
>
> So many that I'm legitimately concerned.
> 
> Also, if someone really thinks that PP Zoe sexualizes her... I'm pretty sure they're the one with the sexual thoughts they are apparently condemning.

We sadly live in a world where tickling is a sexual fetish, popping ballons, etc... 
Even for how modest it is, we know there is someone who thinks it is attractive. Mix this with how anime loli's are a big rage in places, and how even though riot is a U.S. Studio, it is owned by tencent, and could argue they are influenced to pander to anime esk themes engrained in eastern culture, while still relavent in western. which entails things like star guardians, and how there are so many. 
Do I personally like it, not really. Pool party is kinda known as a set of skins for fun, but for some is fanservice skins.... And that I feel is what people have a problem with when they talk about pp zoe.

People have had crazy feyishes forever, and you can't change what you're into. But consider what you're shaming. Shaming %%%%philia helps protect children, by helping make sure those people don't actualize their fantasies (which, again, they can't change). What's the benefit of shaming people that are into popping balloons or consensual tickling?

> [{quoted}](name=DearPear,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=lT4OE4LF,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2018-08-14T14:04:55.642+0000)

Didn't really think about this until now but I'd love it if they did a series of just cute pool party skins. like Pool Party Annie with tibbers as a BBQ dad or something and Pool Party Nunu with them as a big bro, lil bro combo.  maybe Pool Party Poppy with a rescue buoy and a squeaky hammer. something like that.
And Pool Party Gragas as that weird uncle who no one invites yet he always shows up and gets smashed despite there being no alcohol in a 10 mile radius.
that's his secret cap, he's always drunk

I get the sentiment of not wanting to see children in BIKINI'S 

But Zoe isn't wearing a bikini. It's just a throw-over bathing suit.

There are uneducated potatoes on this forum that believe a parent bathing their child in a bathtub is sexualizing them.

What more do I need to say.

> [{quoted}](name=Decahexatris1,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=lT4OE4LF,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2018-08-14T15:38:21.644+0000)

i actually read on some feminist publishing that fathers shouldn't be allowed to bathe their infant daughters a few years ago. it's fuckin wild
good luck single fathers.
Just send them through the carwash apparently

Okay so. Right after i made this post i checked out Reddit. There is a thread there about Nunu interactions and one of his interactions in game is that he calls Annie pretty.

The comments fucking exploded with "Riot sexualizing kids again" comments.

Like.. really? So he has a crush and called her pretty. Thats not sexualization.

Holy fuck. My faith in humanity is hurtin boys.
You and me both fam.
child champion calls other child champion pretty. clearly sexualization right everyone. not like kids aren't allowed to have a crush on girls/boys too -.-
you got a link to it so i can read?
"feminist". Please put quotes around that. kinda tired of this whole "celebrity said something stupid clearly this is what feminism is about." Honestly.
http://www.barenakedislam.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/mit-burka-im-swimmingpool-3ba1733a-5147-4bf9-a6f9-3afef6658e60-e1438108699666__tc_thumb_item_large.jpg

swim suits being "sexualization" is *usually* really stupid. its the reason so many female beach skins are wetsuits or sunbather's outfits. PP {{champion:51}} is literally the closest I've ever seen as an outfit that an adult female could swim in, ({{champion:142}} looks 12 so she should be easier to do with the whole one-piece swim dress thing) females swimming is one of those things where it's tabbu to show reality for some reason.

but yeah if you think PP Zoe is sexual that tells more on you than Riot.

To be fair, this thing started way before, when some people started saying that "Riot can't make a Pool Party Annie skin because that could be considered sexualizing children". 

I don't know if this is true at all, but I have read it many times as the reason to no create a Pool Party Annie skin. 

Also, when Zoe lore was revealed, many people mentioned that saying "she looks 12 but is actually 3,000 years old" is a tipical excuse for lolis in certain anime subgenres. 

I don't know if people have been watching too much weird hentai lately or something, but yeah, I have read this kind of comments in different threads many times. For example, yesterday I read someone saying that Zoe's lore was an excuse so they can make skins like Pool Party Zoe without starting a controversy.

> [{quoted}](name=Thilmer,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=lT4OE4LF,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-08-14T14:09:59.911+0000)
>
> To be fair, this thing started way before, when some people started saying that "Riot can't make a Pool Party Annie skin because that could be considered sexualizing children". 
> 
> I don't know if this is true at all, but I have read it many times as the reason to no create a Pool Party Annie skin. 
> 
> Also, when Zoe lore was revealed, many people mentioned that saying "she looks 12 but is actually 3,000 years old" is a tipical excuse for lolis in certain anime subgenres. 
> 
> I don't know if people have been watching too much weird hentai lately or something, but yeah, I have read this kind of comments in different threads many times. For example, yesterday I read someone saying that Zoe's lore was an excuse so they can make skins like Pool Party Zoe without starting a controversy.

This "controversy" is utterly stupid, and completely unfounded. There have been _countless_ lollis in anime who wear age appropriate swimwear, and having Zoe or even Annie in swimwear isn't going to qualify as sexualization - Zoe's is proof, it's age appropriate and exactly what a kid would wear. The people "concerned" about these swimsuits are clearly more deeply disturbed than they're letting on.

OP your logic is dogshit

Person: "I have a sincere worry that creating a swimsuit skin for an underage character could end with unnecessary people getting even more unnecessary ideas."
OP: "wow u %%%% dont go near pools reee"

> [{quoted}](name=Kazo Kurosu,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=lT4OE4LF,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2018-08-14T16:55:10.408+0000)
>
> OP your logic is dogshit
> 
> Person: "I have a sincere worry that creating a swimsuit skin for an underage character could end with unnecessary people getting even more unnecessary ideas."
> OP: "wow u %%%% dont go near pools reee"

OPs argument is that the skin is made completely decent without any sexual implications, something age appropriate simply meant to look cute, the argument made is that with the outrage people are bringing over the sexualization of characters such as Zoe does not lie with Riot as they simply made a cute age appropriate skin for the summer season but the fault instead lie with players who seem to look for something to be angry at, blaming riot for sexualizing a child despite a swimsuit not inherently being something sexual.

Pool Party Zoe is a good skin her childish swimsuit completely covering her and her accessories making the entire outfit somewhat silly and fun, it is in no way sexual and saying it is, could say more about the way you view these things.

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/4/4d/Zoe_PoolParty_concept_01.jpg
Seriously though, look at this design and tell me if there's anything sexual about it, because if you swapped around the colours a bit and removed her swimming accessories this would just be a summer dress.
I thought people saying poolparty Zoe was made in colab with the FBI was just a meme lol
L M A O. If anyone irl tells me how pool party Zoe is sexualized imma punch their feminime face
